xrCG.title: OpenGL experiments
description: Using mostly OpenGL, GLSL and C++, I'm currently developing a small tool where I can quickly create scenes and test different shaders, in order to replicate interesting and visually appealing scenes I commonly see in the media I appreciate.
The goal is not only to create this system, but also expand on my knowledge of how the graphics pipeline works at the lower level.

I not only hope to improve my general knowledge of graphics programming this way, but also to understand how common performance optimizations work deep down, and overall how the systems that we use to create stunning visuals work under the hood.
contributions: Design and implement a simple renderer
Load and apply shaders to different objects
Parse a scene from a file
Play around with different types of common shaders

xrCG.title: Shadertoy
description: On this platform, I have been playing around with shadder programming, trying to recreate some interesting effects I have seen in games and other media I enjoy.
Check out the shaders I have published on my profile!
There's a lot more where those came from!

xrCG.title: Thesis Project
description: Currently working on my Master's thesis in collaboration with INESC TEC, to explore challenges in capturing and rendering realistic 3D environments and objects, and study how these processes can be optimized for WebVR experiences.
contributions: Obtain dataset of images for generating 3D representations of a scene
Generate 3D representations of the scene using Photogrammetry, NERFs and 3D Gaussian Splatting
Define metrics and compare the three methods according to them
Implement a WebVR system for each representation, and analyse the systems' performance
Apply and experiment with common rendering optimizations on each system

xrCG.title: VR A-Frame Explorer
description: Project focused on both exploring the generation of photo-realistic 3D models based on real places, and on the development of a platform to explore these models on.
contributions: Captured a dataset of images for the model generation
Generated models based on the image dataset with photogrammetry, and in real time with LiDAR technology
Developed a WebXR platform to view and explore the models on
Ported some of Felix Mariotto's three-mesh-ui library to A-Frame, in order to help with UI creation
Developed a simple web server to host and serve our models, and allow uploading custom models

xrCG.title: Lost in the Drift
description: Get ready to drift onto the scene in this nostalgia-infused infinite runner which pays homage to old school PS1 racing games, with their stylized visuals and slippery challenging controls.
The goal is simple: avoid obstacles, and get as far as you can while keeping your RC car on the road, or you risk losing the signal.
This game was developed in 48 hours for the 2024 Retro Jam, organized by the IEEE UP Student Branch.
contributions: Designed and developed VFX and post-processing shaders
Developed the UI, enemy pathfinding and spawning, among other mechanics
Added sound effects

xrCG.title: Interactive Graphics Systems Final Project
description: Final project of the Interactive Graphics Systems Course of the Masters in Informatics and Computing Engineering (M.EIC) of FEUP, during the year 2022/2023.
The project consists of a WebGL checkers game. Players take turns selecting their pieces and make moves. Players can undo their moves if necessary, and save a replay of their game at the end.
The project also contains an XML parser which reads a scene and creates it from the data contained on an XML file encoding the scene's graph, according to a pre-determined format.

For this project, we also had to create a visually appealing scene, with textures, animations, lights, decorative elements. Because of our parser, we were also able to read other students' scenes, and play the game on the scenes they designed.
A big focus of this project was making this system as efficient and error prone as possible.
contributions: Created general primitives (ranging from simple triangles to toruses)
Created an XML parser to parse scene graphs and build the scene based on the file's data
Designed a scene file with decorative elements, lighting sources, animations, textures, among others
Implemented shaders for visual feedback when performing certain game interactions
Designed and implemented the main game mechanics and logic
Implemented a system for saving or replaying a game

xrCG.title: Computer Graphics Final Project
description: Final project of the Interactive Graphics Systems Course of the Masters in Informatics and Computing Engineering (M.EIC) of FEUP, during the year 2022/2023.

The project involved the design and implementation of a system which allows us to build a complex underwater aquarium scene, with textures, shaders (including a moving water shader), among other decorative elements.
For this project, we were also tasked with creating a fish model, some animations and interactive elements, such as stones the player can pick up by controlling the fish.
A big focus of this project was getting familiar with the fundamentals of Computer Graphics, learning the best practices of creating a robust and efficient graphics system.
contributions: Developed primitives which allows us to model the aquarium scene with a fish and decorative elements
Implemented some shaders, including a moving water shader
Implemented animations which adapt to speed and direction
Add interactive elements to the scene, and scene controls

gameDev.title: Lucky Lapin
description: Second place entry for ||Fabamaq[www.fabamaq.com/en]||'s ||Invictus Game Jam[invictvs.fabamaq.com/en]||.
In this game, you control a rabbit on a quest for vengeance against a tyrannical casino owner, who kidnapped your family in order to sell their rabbit legs to unsuspecting gamblers.
The game was designed and developed to run on Fabamaq's in-house slot machines, taking advantage of their hardware, lights and sound systems.
contributions: Actively participated in design decisions
Implemented the connectivity between the game and the slot machine's hardware
Developed and tweaked some of the game's mechanics

gameDev.title: Miasma
description: Final project of the Game Development Course of the Masters in Informatics and Computing Engineering (M.EIC) of FEUP, during the year 2022/2023.

In this high-octane movement-based game, players take control of an amnesiac android, and must run, jump and air-strafe their way out of a facility filled with deadly traps and enemies, while trying to piece back together their memories.
A demo video of the game can be found ||here[youtu.be/FEsYICmPof8?si=qzDJRhfsSXkZtmkS]||.
contributions: Performed game design related tasks
Implemented of some of the game weapon mechanics
Recorded, sampled and edited sound effects and music for the game
Performed some minor rigging and editing of test assets for the game

gameDev.title: FEUP Hell
description: Preliminary project of the Game Development Course of the Masters in Informatics and Computing Engineering (M.EIC) of FEUP, during the year 2022/2023.

In this game, players try to last for as long as they can against an endless horde of undead cubes, in a stage reminiscent of FEUP's installations, with the help of a wide variety of weapons and perks!
A demo video of the game can be found ||here[youtu.be/B-S8YoB5miI?si=83otXu-ipS1gXJKy]||.
contributions: Performed game design related tasks
Performed general development of the game
3D model gathering and cleanup
